TopicTitle: What Facts Do We Know About The Devs Leaving?

14 hours ago, J.Random said:

Huh, I'm not banned anymore? Weird.

Wait a second. Are you saying that both 1.0 and 1.1 were entirely on developers, and not a result of decisions from management? That developers all by themselves just decided to work crazy OT and then leave a Niagara-style memory leaking release for two months? That developers just decided to impose deadlines on themselves and end the prerelease testing prematurely?

Did you actually follow the development of KSP? Many versions had a bunch of big issues that had to be fixed afterwards. And 1.1 wasn't even that bad.

I have a funny feeling the 8 guys in question are watching this thread and others like it with no small amount of bemusement. 

I still think apologies are due to RoverDude though. He got pretty ugly treatment for trying to do the right thing.

Most certainly apologies are due towards @RoverDude, as I have said before. I have also said that people have the right to inquire into whatever the heck they want, and SQUAD has the right to ignore them. So why are we still heatedly bickering over this?

1 hour ago, nestor said:

Fact: 1.3 is confirmed, there are already devs working on this new version

As happy as I am about ksp continuing to be developed, part of me is quite exhausted with the constant updates. That being said,  if 1.2 has a long life span,  my exhaustion wont be so bad. Obviously let's fix the game breaking bugs but let 1.2 go for about a year before releasing anything anything new. I think I can speak for the majority of the players when I say mods are what make this game truly special and most people don't like waiting for mods to be updated every 3-4 months. I'm also sure it has caused some talented developers to close up shop. It's been a constant game of catch up. I'm not saying I don't appreciate the work Squad does and how it has the players in mind when working on new features and bug fixes, I'm just saying it's exhausting  I know what I am saying here will probably fall on deaf ears and that's fine,  I just wanted to say this.  I feel better now.
Well, whatever the outcome or conclusions these threads generate it's certainly giving my phone battery a jolly good workout.
At least we got some new info and I can stop reading every post.
